trans-unit.source: Contains information information that the GetOpenFileName and GetSaveFileName functions use to initialize an Open or Save As dialog box

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window that owns the dialog box. This member can be any valid window handle, or it can be NULL if the dialog box has no owner.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window that owns the dialog box.
This member can be any valid window handle, or it can be NULL if the dialog box has no owner.

target.mrk: Handle to the window that owns the dialog box.
This member can be any valid window handle, or it can be NULL if the dialog box has no owner.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE flag is set in the Flags member, hInstance is a handle to a memory object containing a dialog box template.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE flag is set in the Flags member, hInstance is a handle to a memory object containing a dialog box template.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE flag is set in the Flags member, hInstance is a handle to a memory object containing a dialog box template.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE flag is set, hInstance is a handle to a module that contains a dialog box template named by the lpTemplateName member.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE flag is set, hInstance is a handle to a module that contains a dialog box template named by the lpTemplateName member.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE flag is set, hInstance is a handle to a module that contains a dialog box template named by the lpTemplateName member.

trans-unit.source: If neither flag is set, this member is ignored.

seg-source.mrk: If neither flag is set, this member is ignored.

target.mrk: If neither flag is set, this member is ignored.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a buffer containing pairs of null-terminated filter strings. The last string in the buffer must be terminated by two NULL characters.

The last string in the buffer must be terminated by two NULL characters.

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a static buffer that contains a pair of null-terminated filter strings for preserving the filter pattern chosen by the user.

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a static buffer that contains a pair of null-terminated filter strings for preserving the filter pattern chosen by the user.

target.mrk: Pointer to a static buffer that contains a pair of null-terminated filter strings for preserving the filter pattern chosen by the user.

trans-unit.source: The first string is your display string that describes the custom filter, and the second string is the filter pattern selected by the user.

seg-source.mrk: The first string is your display string that describes the custom filter, and the second string is the filter pattern selected by the user.

target.mrk: The first string is your display string that describes the custom filter, and the second string is the filter pattern selected by the user.

trans-unit.source: The first time your application creates the dialog box, you specify the first string, which can be any nonempty string.

seg-source.mrk: The first time your application creates the dialog box, you specify the first string, which can be any nonempty string.

target.mrk: The first time your application creates the dialog box, you specify the first string, which can be any nonempty string.

trans-unit.source: When the user selects a file, the dialog box copies the current filter pattern to the second string.

seg-source.mrk: When the user selects a file, the dialog box copies the current filter pattern to the second string.

target.mrk: When the user selects a file, the dialog box copies the current filter pattern to the second string.

trans-unit.source: The preserved filter pattern can be one of the patterns specified in the lpstrFilter buffer, or it can be a filter pattern typed by the user.

seg-source.mrk: The preserved filter pattern can be one of the patterns specified in the lpstrFilter buffer, or it can be a filter pattern typed by the user.

target.mrk: The preserved filter pattern can be one of the patterns specified in the lpstrFilter buffer, or it can be a filter pattern typed by the user.

trans-unit.source: The system uses the strings to initialize the user-defined file filter the next time the dialog box is created.

seg-source.mrk: The system uses the strings to initialize the user-defined file filter the next time the dialog box is created.

target.mrk: The system uses the strings to initialize the user-defined file filter the next time the dialog box is created.

trans-unit.source: If the nFilterIndex member is zero, the dialog box uses the custom filter.

seg-source.mrk: If the nFilterIndex member is zero, the dialog box uses the custom filter.

target.mrk: If the nFilterIndex member is zero, the dialog box uses the custom filter.

trans-unit.source: If this member is NULL, the dialog box does not preserve user-defined filter patterns.

seg-source.mrk: If this member is NULL, the dialog box does not preserve user-defined filter patterns.

target.mrk: If this member is NULL, the dialog box does not preserve user-defined filter patterns.

trans-unit.source: If this member is not NULL, the value of the nMaxCustFilter member must specify the size, in TCHARs, of the lpstrCustomFilter buffer.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the index of the currently selected filter in the File Types control.

trans-unit.source: The buffer pointed to by lpstrFilter contains pairs of strings that define the filters.

target.mrk: The buffer pointed to by lpstrFilter contains pairs of strings that define the filters.

trans-unit.source: The first pair of strings has an index value of 1, the second pair 2, and so on.

target.mrk: The first pair of strings has an index value of 1, the second pair 2, and so on.

trans-unit.source: An index of zero indicates the custom filter specified by lpstrCustomFilter.

target.mrk: An index of zero indicates the custom filter specified by lpstrCustomFilter.

trans-unit.source: You can specify an index on input to indicate the initial filter description and filter pattern for the dialog box.

target.mrk: You can specify an index on input to indicate the initial filter description and filter pattern for the dialog box.

target.mrk: When the user selects a file, nFilterIndex returns the index of the currently displayed filter.

trans-unit.source: If nFilterIndex is zero and lpstrCustomFilter is NULL, the system uses the first filter in the lpstrFilter buffer.

target.mrk: If nFilterIndex is zero and lpstrCustomFilter is NULL, the system uses the first filter in the lpstrFilter buffer.

trans-unit.source: If all three members are zero or NULL, the system does not use any filters and does not show any files in the file list control of the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: When the _WinAPI_GetOpenFileName or _WinAPI_GetSaveFileName function returns successfully, this buffer contains the drive designator, path, file name, and extension of the selected file.

target.mrk: When the _WinAPI_GetOpenFileName or _WinAPI_GetSaveFileName function returns successfully, this buffer contains the drive designator, path, file name, and extension of the selected file.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is set and the user selects multiple files, the buffer contains the current directory followed by the file names of the selected files.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is set and the user selects multiple files, the buffer contains the current directory followed by the file names of the selected files.

trans-unit.source: For Explorer-style dialog boxes, the directory and file name strings are NULL separated, with an extra NULL character after the last file name.

target.mrk: For Explorer-style dialog boxes, the directory and file name strings are NULL separated, with an extra NULL character after the last file name.

trans-unit.source: For old-style dialog boxes, the strings are space separated and the function uses short file names for file names with spaces.

target.mrk: For old-style dialog boxes, the strings are space separated and the function uses short file names for file names with spaces.

trans-unit.source: You can use the FindFirstFile function to convert between long and short file names.

target.mrk: You can use the FindFirstFile function to convert between long and short file names.

trans-unit.source: If the user selects only one file, the lpstrFile string does not have a separator between the path and file name.

target.mrk: If the user selects only one file, the lpstrFile string does not have a separator between the path and file name.

trans-unit.source: If the buffer is too small, the function returns False and the _WinAPI_CommDlgExtendedError function returns $FNERR_BUFFERTOOSMALL.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the first two bytes of the lpstrFile buffer contain the required size, in bytes or characters.

trans-unit.source: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box. When the dialog box returns, it sets these flags to indicate the user's input. This member can be a combination of the following flags.

seg-source.mrk: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.
When the dialog box returns, it sets these flags to indicate the user's input.
This member can be a combination of the following flags.

target.mrk: A set of bit flags you can use to initialize the dialog box.
When the dialog box returns, it sets these flags to indicate the user's input.
This member can be a combination of the following flags.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT - Specifies that the File Name list box allows multiple selections.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT - Specifies that the File Name list box allows multiple selections.

target.mrk: $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT - Specifies that the File Name list box allows multiple selections.

trans-unit.source: If you also set the $OFN_EXPLORER flag, the dialog box uses the Explorer-style user interface; otherwise, it uses the old-style user interface.

seg-source.mrk: If you also set the $OFN_EXPLORER flag, the dialog box uses the Explorer-style user interface; otherwise, it uses the old-style user interface.

target.mrk: If you also set the $OFN_EXPLORER flag, the dialog box uses the Explorer-style user interface; otherwise, it uses the old-style user interface.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_CREATEPROMPT - If the user specifies a file that does not exist, this flag causes the dialog box to prompt the user for permission to create the file.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_CREATEPROMPT - If the user specifies a file that does not exist, this flag causes the dialog box to prompt the user for permission to create the file.

target.mrk: $OFN_CREATEPROMPT - If the user specifies a file that does not exist, this flag causes the dialog box to prompt the user for permission to create the file.

trans-unit.source: If the user chooses to create the file, the dialog box closes and the function returns the specified name; otherwise, the dialog box remains open.

seg-source.mrk: If the user chooses to create the file, the dialog box closes and the function returns the specified name; otherwise, the dialog box remains open.

target.mrk: If the user chooses to create the file, the dialog box closes and the function returns the specified name; otherwise, the dialog box remains open.

trans-unit.source: If you use this flag with the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag, the dialog box allows the user to specify only one nonexistent file.

seg-source.mrk: If you use this flag with the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag, the dialog box allows the user to specify only one nonexistent file.

target.mrk: If you use this flag with the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag, the dialog box allows the user to specify only one nonexistent file.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_DONTADDTORECENT - Prevents the system from adding a link to the selected file in the file system directory that contains the user's most recently used documents.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_DONTADDTORECENT - Prevents the system from adding a link to the selected file in the file system directory that contains the user's most recently used documents.

target.mrk: $OFN_DONTADDTORECENT - Prevents the system from adding a link to the selected file in the file system directory that contains the user's most recently used documents.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_ENABLEHOOK - Enables the hook function specified in the lpfnHook member.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_ENABLEHOOK - Enables the hook function specified in the lpfnHook member.

target.mrk: $OFN_ENABLEHOOK - Enables the hook function specified in the lpfnHook member.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_ENABLEINCLUDENOTIFY - Causes the dialog box to send CDN_INCLUDEITEM notification messages to your OFNHookProc hook procedure when the user opens a folder.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_ENABLEINCLUDENOTIFY - Causes the dialog box to send CDN_INCLUDEITEM notification messages to your OFNHookProc hook procedure when the user opens a folder.

target.mrk: $OFN_ENABLEINCLUDENOTIFY - Causes the dialog box to send CDN_INCLUDEITEM notification messages to your OFNHookProc hook procedure when the user opens a folder.

trans-unit.source: The dialog box sends a notification for each item in the newly opened folder.

seg-source.mrk: The dialog box sends a notification for each item in the newly opened folder.

target.mrk: The dialog box sends a notification for each item in the newly opened folder.

trans-unit.source: These messages enable you to control which items the dialog box displays in the folder's item list.

seg-source.mrk: These messages enable you to control which items the dialog box displays in the folder's item list.

target.mrk: These messages enable you to control which items the dialog box displays in the folder's item list.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_ENABLESIZING - Enables the Explorer-style dialog box to be resized using either the mouse or the keyboard.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_ENABLESIZING - Enables the Explorer-style dialog box to be resized using either the mouse or the keyboard.

target.mrk: $OFN_ENABLESIZING - Enables the Explorer-style dialog box to be resized using either the mouse or the keyboard.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Explorer-style Open and Save As dialog boxes allow the dialog box to be resized regardless of whether this flag is set.

seg-source.mrk: By default, the Explorer-style Open and Save As dialog boxes allow the dialog box to be resized regardless of whether this flag is set.

target.mrk: By default, the Explorer-style Open and Save As dialog boxes allow the dialog box to be resized regardless of whether this flag is set.

trans-unit.source: This flag is necessary only if you provide a hook procedure or custom template. The old-style dialog box does not permit resizing.

seg-source.mrk: This flag is necessary only if you provide a hook procedure or custom template.
The old-style dialog box does not permit resizing.

target.mrk: This flag is necessary only if you provide a hook procedure or custom template.
The old-style dialog box does not permit resizing.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE - Indicates that the lpTemplateName member is a pointer to the name of a dialog template resource in the module identified by the hInstance member.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE - Indicates that the lpTemplateName member is a pointer to the name of a dialog template resource in the module identified by the hInstance member.

target.mrk: $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATE - Indicates that the lpTemplateName member is a pointer to the name of a dialog template resource in the module identified by the hInstance member.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE - Indicates that the hInstance member identifies a data block that contains a preloaded dialog box template.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE - Indicates that the hInstance member identifies a data block that contains a preloaded dialog box template.

target.mrk: $OFN_ENABLETEMPLATEHANDLE - Indicates that the hInstance member identifies a data block that contains a preloaded dialog box template.

trans-unit.source: The system ignores lpTemplateName if this flag is specified.

seg-source.mrk: The system ignores lpTemplateName if this flag is specified.

target.mrk: The system ignores lpTemplateName if this flag is specified.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is set, the system uses the specified template to create a dialog box that is a child of the default Explorer-style dialog box.

trans-unit.source: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

target.mrk: If the $OFN_EXPLORER flag is not set, the system uses the template to create an old-style dialog box that replaces the default dialog box.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_EXPLORER - Indicates that any customizations made to the Open or Save As dialog box use the new Explorer-style customization methods.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_EXPLORER - Indicates that any customizations made to the Open or Save As dialog box use the new Explorer-style customization methods.

target.mrk: $OFN_EXPLORER - Indicates that any customizations made to the Open or Save As dialog box use the new Explorer-style customization methods.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Open and Save As dialog boxes use the Explorer-style user interface regardless of whether this flag is set.

seg-source.mrk: By default, the Open and Save As dialog boxes use the Explorer-style user interface regardless of whether this flag is set.

target.mrk: By default, the Open and Save As dialog boxes use the Explorer-style user interface regardless of whether this flag is set.

trans-unit.source: This flag is necessary only if you provide a hook procedure or custom template, or set the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag.

seg-source.mrk: This flag is necessary only if you provide a hook procedure or custom template, or set the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag.

target.mrk: This flag is necessary only if you provide a hook procedure or custom template, or set the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag.

trans-unit.source: If you want the old-style user interface, omit the $OFN_EXPLORER flag and provide a replacement old-style template or hook procedure.

seg-source.mrk: If you want the old-style user interface, omit the $OFN_EXPLORER flag and provide a replacement old-style template or hook procedure.

target.mrk: If you want the old-style user interface, omit the $OFN_EXPLORER flag and provide a replacement old-style template or hook procedure.

trans-unit.source: If you want the old style but do not need a custom template or hook procedure, simply provide a hook procedure that always returns False.

seg-source.mrk: If you want the old style but do not need a custom template or hook procedure, simply provide a hook procedure that always returns False.

target.mrk: If you want the old style but do not need a custom template or hook procedure, simply provide a hook procedure that always returns False.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_EXTENSIONDIFFERENT - Specifies that the user typed a file name extension that differs from the extension specified by lpstrDefExt.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_EXTENSIONDIFFERENT - Specifies that the user typed a file name extension that differs from the extension specified by lpstrDefExt.

target.mrk: $OFN_EXTENSIONDIFFERENT - Specifies that the user typed a file name extension that differs from the extension specified by lpstrDefExt.

trans-unit.source: The function does not use this flag if lpstrDefExt is NULL.

seg-source.mrk: The function does not use this flag if lpstrDefExt is NULL.

target.mrk: The function does not use this flag if lpstrDefExt is NULL.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_FILEMUSTEXIST - Specifies that the user can type only names of existing files in the File Name entry field.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_FILEMUSTEXIST - Specifies that the user can type only names of existing files in the File Name entry field.

target.mrk: $OFN_FILEMUSTEXIST - Specifies that the user can type only names of existing files in the File Name entry field.

trans-unit.source: If this flag is specified and the user enters an invalid name, the dialog box procedure displays a warning in a message box.

seg-source.mrk: If this flag is specified and the user enters an invalid name, the dialog box procedure displays a warning in a message box.

target.mrk: If this flag is specified and the user enters an invalid name, the dialog box procedure displays a warning in a message box.

trans-unit.source: If this flag is specified, the $OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST flag is also used. This flag can be used in an Open dialog box. It cannot be used with a Save As dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: If this flag is specified, the $OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST flag is also used.
This flag can be used in an Open dialog box.
It cannot be used with a Save As dialog box.

target.mrk: If this flag is specified, the $OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST flag is also used.
This flag can be used in an Open dialog box.
It cannot be used with a Save As dialog box.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_FORCESHOWHIDDEN - Forces the showing of system and hidden files, thus overriding the user setting to show or not show hidden files.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_FORCESHOWHIDDEN - Forces the showing of system and hidden files, thus overriding the user setting to show or not show hidden files.

target.mrk: $OFN_FORCESHOWHIDDEN - Forces the showing of system and hidden files, thus overriding the user setting to show or not show hidden files.

trans-unit.source: However, a file that is marked both system and hidden is not shown.

seg-source.mrk: However, a file that is marked both system and hidden is not shown.

target.mrk: However, a file that is marked both system and hidden is not shown.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_HIDEREADONLY - Hides the Read Only check box.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_HIDEREADONLY - Hides the Read Only check box.

target.mrk: $OFN_HIDEREADONLY - Hides the Read Only check box.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_LONGNAMES - For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use long file names.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_LONGNAMES - For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use long file names.

target.mrk: $OFN_LONGNAMES - For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use long file names.

trans-unit.source: If this flag is not specified, or if the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is also set, old-style dialog boxes use short file names (8.3 format) for file names with spaces.

seg-source.mrk: If this flag is not specified, or if the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is also set, old-style dialog boxes use short file names (8.3 format) for file names with spaces.

target.mrk: If this flag is not specified, or if the $OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT flag is also set, old-style dialog boxes use short file names (8.3 format) for file names with spaces.

trans-unit.source: Explorer-style dialog boxes ignore this flag and always display long file names.

seg-source.mrk: Explorer-style dialog boxes ignore this flag and always display long file names.

target.mrk: Explorer-style dialog boxes ignore this flag and always display long file names.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_NOCHANGEDIR - Restores the current directory to its original value if the user changed the directory while searching for files.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_NOCHANGEDIR - Restores the current directory to its original value if the user changed the directory while searching for files.

target.mrk: $OFN_NOCHANGEDIR - Restores the current directory to its original value if the user changed the directory while searching for files.

trans-unit.source: This flag is ineffective for GetOpenFileName.

seg-source.mrk: This flag is ineffective for GetOpenFileName.

target.mrk: This flag is ineffective for GetOpenFileName.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_NODEREFERENCELINKS - Directs the dialog box to return the path and file name of the selected shortcut (.LNK) file.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_NODEREFERENCELINKS - Directs the dialog box to return the path and file name of the selected shortcut (.LNK) file.

target.mrk: $OFN_NODEREFERENCELINKS - Directs the dialog box to return the path and file name of the selected shortcut (.LNK) file.

trans-unit.source: If this value is not specified, the dialog box returns the path and file name of the file referenced by the shortcut.

seg-source.mrk: If this value is not specified, the dialog box returns the path and file name of the file referenced by the shortcut.

target.mrk: If this value is not specified, the dialog box returns the path and file name of the file referenced by the shortcut.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_NOLONGNAMES - For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use short file names (8.3 format).

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_NOLONGNAMES - For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use short file names (8.3 format).

target.mrk: $OFN_NOLONGNAMES - For old-style dialog boxes, this flag causes the dialog box to use short file names (8.3 format).

trans-unit.source: Explorer-style dialog boxes ignore this flag and always display long file names.

seg-source.mrk: Explorer-style dialog boxes ignore this flag and always display long file names.

target.mrk: Explorer-style dialog boxes ignore this flag and always display long file names.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_NONETWORKBUTTON - Hides and disables the Network button.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_NONETWORKBUTTON - Hides and disables the Network button.

target.mrk: $OFN_NONETWORKBUTTON - Hides and disables the Network button.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_NOREADONLYRETURN - Specifies that the returned file does not have the Read Only check box selected and is not in a write-protected directory.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_NOREADONLYRETURN - Specifies that the returned file does not have the Read Only check box selected and is not in a write-protected directory.

target.mrk: $OFN_NOREADONLYRETURN - Specifies that the returned file does not have the Read Only check box selected and is not in a write-protected directory.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_NOTESTFILECREATE - Specifies that the file is not created before the dialog box is closed.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_NOTESTFILECREATE - Specifies that the file is not created before the dialog box is closed.

target.mrk: $OFN_NOTESTFILECREATE - Specifies that the file is not created before the dialog box is closed.

trans-unit.source: This flag should be specified if the application saves the file on a create-nonmodify network share.

seg-source.mrk: This flag should be specified if the application saves the file on a create-nonmodify network share.

target.mrk: This flag should be specified if the application saves the file on a create-nonmodify network share.

trans-unit.source: When an application specifies this flag, the library does not check for write protection, a full disk, an open drive door, or network protection.

seg-source.mrk: When an application specifies this flag, the library does not check for write protection, a full disk, an open drive door, or network protection.

target.mrk: When an application specifies this flag, the library does not check for write protection, a full disk, an open drive door, or network protection.

trans-unit.source: Applications using this flag must perform file operations carefully, because a file cannot be reopened once it is closed.

seg-source.mrk: Applications using this flag must perform file operations carefully, because a file cannot be reopened once it is closed.

target.mrk: Applications using this flag must perform file operations carefully, because a file cannot be reopened once it is closed.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_NOVALIDATE - Specifies that the common dialog boxes allow invalid characters in the returned file name.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_NOVALIDATE - Specifies that the common dialog boxes allow invalid characters in the returned file name.

target.mrk: $OFN_NOVALIDATE - Specifies that the common dialog boxes allow invalid characters in the returned file name.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the calling application uses a hook procedure that checks the file name by using the FILEOKSTRING message.

seg-source.mrk: Typically, the calling application uses a hook procedure that checks the file name by using the FILEOKSTRING message.

target.mrk: Typically, the calling application uses a hook procedure that checks the file name by using the FILEOKSTRING message.

trans-unit.source: If the text box in the edit control is empty or contains nothing but spaces, the lists of files and directories are updated.

seg-source.mrk: If the text box in the edit control is empty or contains nothing but spaces, the lists of files and directories are updated.

target.mrk: If the text box in the edit control is empty or contains nothing but spaces, the lists of files and directories are updated.

trans-unit.source: If the text box in the edit control contains anything else, nFileOffset and nFileExtension are set to values generated by parsing the text.

seg-source.mrk: If the text box in the edit control contains anything else, nFileOffset and nFileExtension are set to values generated by parsing the text.

target.mrk: If the text box in the edit control contains anything else, nFileOffset and nFileExtension are set to values generated by parsing the text.

trans-unit.source: No default extension is added to the text, nor is text copied to the buffer specified by lpstrFileTitle.

seg-source.mrk: No default extension is added to the text, nor is text copied to the buffer specified by lpstrFileTitle.

target.mrk: No default extension is added to the text, nor is text copied to the buffer specified by lpstrFileTitle.

trans-unit.source: If the value specified by nFileOffset is less than zero, the file name is invalid.

seg-source.mrk: If the value specified by nFileOffset is less than zero, the file name is invalid.

target.mrk: If the value specified by nFileOffset is less than zero, the file name is invalid.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the file name is valid, and nFileExtension and nFileOffset can be used as if the $OFN_NOVALIDATE flag had not been specified.

seg-source.mrk: Otherwise, the file name is valid, and nFileExtension and nFileOffset can be used as if the $OFN_NOVALIDATE flag had not been specified.

target.mrk: Otherwise, the file name is valid, and nFileExtension and nFileOffset can be used as if the $OFN_NOVALIDATE flag had not been specified.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT - Causes the Save As dialog box to generate a message box if the selected file already exists.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT - Causes the Save As dialog box to generate a message box if the selected file already exists.

target.mrk: $OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT - Causes the Save As dialog box to generate a message box if the selected file already exists.

trans-unit.source: The user must confirm whether to overwrite the file.

seg-source.mrk: The user must confirm whether to overwrite the file.

target.mrk: The user must confirm whether to overwrite the file.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST - Specifies that the user can type only valid paths and file names.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST - Specifies that the user can type only valid paths and file names.

target.mrk: $OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST - Specifies that the user can type only valid paths and file names.

trans-unit.source: If this flag is used and the user types an invalid path and file name in the File Name entry field, the dialog box function displays a warning in a message box.

seg-source.mrk: If this flag is used and the user types an invalid path and file name in the File Name entry field, the dialog box function displays a warning in a message box.

target.mrk: If this flag is used and the user types an invalid path and file name in the File Name entry field, the dialog box function displays a warning in a message box.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_READONLY - Causes the Read Only check box to be selected initially when the dialog box is created.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_READONLY - Causes the Read Only check box to be selected initially when the dialog box is created.

target.mrk: $OFN_READONLY - Causes the Read Only check box to be selected initially when the dialog box is created.

trans-unit.source: This flag indicates the state of the Read Only check box when the dialog box is closed.

seg-source.mrk: This flag indicates the state of the Read Only check box when the dialog box is closed.

target.mrk: This flag indicates the state of the Read Only check box when the dialog box is closed.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_SHAREAWARE - Specifies that if a call to the OpenFile function fails because of a network sharing violation, the error is ignored and the dialog box returns the selected file name.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_SHAREAWARE - Specifies that if a call to the OpenFile function fails because of a network sharing violation, the error is ignored and the dialog box returns the selected file name.

target.mrk: $OFN_SHAREAWARE - Specifies that if a call to the OpenFile function fails because of a network sharing violation, the error is ignored and the dialog box returns the selected file name.

trans-unit.source: If this flag is not set, the dialog box notifies your hook procedure when a network sharing violation occurs for the file name specified by the user.

seg-source.mrk: If this flag is not set, the dialog box notifies your hook procedure when a network sharing violation occurs for the file name specified by the user.

target.mrk: If this flag is not set, the dialog box notifies your hook procedure when a network sharing violation occurs for the file name specified by the user.

trans-unit.source: If you set the $OFN_EXPLORER flag, the dialog box sends the CDN_SHAREVIOLATION message to the hook procedure.

seg-source.mrk: If you set the $OFN_EXPLORER flag, the dialog box sends the CDN_SHAREVIOLATION message to the hook procedure.

target.mrk: If you set the $OFN_EXPLORER flag, the dialog box sends the CDN_SHAREVIOLATION message to the hook procedure.

trans-unit.source: If you do not set $OFN_EXPLORER, the dialog box sends the SHAREVISTRING registered message to the hook procedure.

seg-source.mrk: If you do not set $OFN_EXPLORER, the dialog box sends the SHAREVISTRING registered message to the hook procedure.

target.mrk: If you do not set $OFN_EXPLORER, the dialog box sends the SHAREVISTRING registered message to the hook procedure.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_SHOWHELP - Causes the dialog box to display the Help button.

seg-source.mrk: $OFN_SHOWHELP - Causes the dialog box to display the Help button.

target.mrk: $OFN_SHOWHELP - Causes the dialog box to display the Help button.

trans-unit.source: The hwndOwner member must specify the window to receive the HELPMSGSTRING registered messages that the dialog box sends when the user clicks the Help button.

target.mrk: The hwndOwner member must specify the window to receive the HELPMSGSTRING registered messages that the dialog box sends when the user clicks the Help button.

trans-unit.source: An Explorer-style dialog box sends a CDN_HELP notification message to your hook procedure when the user clicks the Help button.

target.mrk: $OFN_USESHELLITEM - Do not use.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the 0-based offset, in TCHARs, from the beginning of the path to the file name in the string pointed to by lpstrFile.

trans-unit.source: $OFN_EX_NOPLACESBAR - If this flag is set, the places bar is not displayed.
